text: Two ships of the United States Navy have borne the name USS Trigger, named in honor of the triggerfish, any of numerous deep-bodied fishes of warm seas having an anterior dorsal fin with two or three stout erectile spines. * The first was a commissioned in 1942 and sunk in 1945. * The second was a submarine, commissioned in 1952, stricken in 1973 and sold to Italy. Category:United States Navy ship names
title: USS Trigger
